titleproper.value:
Guide to the Robert Hammond Papers 
                    <lb/>
                    <date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">ca. 1949-1998 </date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MSS 164</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by / collection processed by Michael Zimmer, June – July 2003

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-04-03T16:08-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Robert Hammond (1920-2009) was an educator and author in French literature and cinema. He taught at the University of Arizona-Tuscon, Harvard University, and SUNY-Cortland, where he also served as chair of the International Communications and Culture Department. Hammond wrote numerous plays, published analyses and criticisms of French filmography, translated various texts, and contributed to the scholarship on French theater and cinema. The Robert Hammond Papers contain original manuscripts of plays, books, articles, interviews, correspondence and other collected works of Hammond.

p.value: Open for research without restrictions. Appointments are necessary to consult archive and manuscript materials.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Robert Hammond Papers ; MSS 164; [box number]; [folder number]; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Series VI contains original production photos (along with photocopies) of three French films.

 Cocteau Reflects for Me, I Reflect for Him (microfiche) 8 1 1984 Eric Rohmer Talks about Film Scripts (handwritten & typed) 8 2 undated An Interview with Bunuel's Scenarist: Jean-Claude Carriere (typed) 8 3 undated Interview with Charles Spaak (handwritten in notebook) 8 4 1957 The King of Hearts and Daniel Boulanger: An Interview (typed) 8 5 undated Subseries III.B: Audio interviews Scope and Contents note

This subseries consists of 28 audiocassettes of interviews conducted by Robert Hammond. There are in two boxes (12 and 13), and are listed here using the labels written on each cassette by Hammond – the cassettes have not been played to confirm their content. Research copies may not be available yet for these recordings. Please check with the Fales Archivist.

 Film Festival Flyers: Marguerite Duras & Charles Spaak 8 8 1986 Les Honneurs de la Guerre (promotional booklet) 8 9 undated Le Lien de Parente (promotional flyer) 8 10 undated Les Nuits de la Pleine Lune (promotional booklet) 8 11 undated O de conduite (promotional flyer) 8 12 undated La Triche (promotional booklet) 8 13 undated Subseries IV.C: Various media and database printouts Scope and Contents note

Diskettes containing various correspondence, audio reels and three “green-bar” format database printouts of the Hammond Film Script Archive (not current). The diskettes and audio tapes are listed here using the labels written by Hammond – their content has not been otherwise confirmed. Research copies may not be available yet for these materials. Please check with the Fales Archivist.
